The User Interface for Interactive Bibliographic Searching: An Analysis of the Attitudes of Nineteen Information Scientists .A Martin, Thomas H. Carlisle, James Treu, Siegfried Since little substantiated evidence exists concerning the features that should of should not be included in the man-machine interface of interactive bibliographic search and retrieval (IBSR) systems, an informal survey tapping the opinions of scientists active in this research area was conducted.. An analysis of the responses showed a significant level of agreement concerning interface features.. .X 61	1	626 124	2	626 125	1	626 127	1	626 129	1	626 165	1	626 190	1	626 191	1	626 197	1	626 211	1	626 214	1	626 218	1	626 243	1	626 274	1	626 307	1	626 320	1	626 330	1	626 332	1	626 343	1	626 378	1	626 381	1	626 417	1	626 448	1	626 450	1	626 451	1	626 452	2	626 458	1	626 459	2	626 468	1	626 484	3	626 492	1	626 508	2	626 511	2	626 512	1	626 514	2	626 516	1	626 518	2	626 520	1	626 521	1	626 522	1	626 523	3	626 524	1	626 525	1	626 526	4	626 527	1	626 528	2	626 529	2	626 530	1	626 534	2	626 546	5	626 553	1	626 575	1	626 579	3	626 594	2	626 603	1	626 604	1	626 606	4	626 609	1	626 610	3	626 611	2	626 612	2	626 615	1	626 625	2	626 626	6	626 630	1	626 636	2	626 637	2	626 642	1	626 648	1	626 650	1	626 692	1	626 696	1	626 699	1	626 700	1	626 703	1	626 705	2	626 707	1	626 708	1	626 726	1	626 727	2	626 728	1	626 731	1	626 732	1	626 733	1	626 734	1	626 736	1	626 738	1	626 739	1	626 740	1	626 741	1	626 742	1	626 743	1	626 744	1	626 754	2	626 755	1	626 812	1	626 814	1	626 817	1	626 820	1	626 824	1	626 826	3	626 827	1	626 830	1	626 875	1	626 879	1	626 883	1	626 1004	1	626 1035	2	626 1078	1	626 1089	1	626 1091	1	626 1207	1	626 1264	1	626 1297	1	626 1303	2	626 1327	1	626 1356	1	626 1364	2	626 1366	1	626 1367	1	626 1368	2	626 1370	1	626 1372	1	626 1373	1	626 1374	2	626 1375	1	626 1376	1	626 1377	1	626 1387	1	626 1427	1	626 1427	1	626
